benchmark_details.name: MemoryAgentBench
benchmark_details.overview: MemoryAgentBench is a unified benchmark specifically designed to evaluate memory agents across four core competencies: accurate retrieval, test-time learning, long-range understanding, and selective forgetting. The benchmark includes transformed existing long-context datasets and newly constructed datasets to simulate multi-turn interactions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation framework for assessing memory agents and their capabilities in memory management.

data.source: Reconstructed from existing long-context datasets and newly created datasets.
data.annotation: Automated generation and processing of datasets.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of memory agents against the provided tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in memory capabilities across evaluated tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance against standard LLMs and existing benchmarks.
methodology.validation: Benchmark evaluated through multiple interactions with varied agent architectures.
